meanings.definition: Old-fashioned or outdated in style or appearance.
meanings.sent1: The fustier furniture in the antique shop caught my eye.
meanings.sent2: Her grandmother's dress looked fustier compared to modern fashion trends.
meanings.sent3: Despite being fustier, the retro dress had a unique charm to it.
meanings.sent4: The fustier design of the vintage car reminded me of a bygone era.
meanings.sent5: The fustier look of the old house made it feel like stepping back in time.

meanings.definition: Covered with a layer of dust or mold.
meanings.sent1: The fustier books on the shelf had not been touched in years.
meanings.sent2: The abandoned room had a musty smell from all the fustier items inside.
meanings.sent3: The fustier corners of the attic were home to some forgotten treasures.
meanings.sent4: She sneezed as she cleaned the fustier curtains in the neglected room.
meanings.sent5: The fustier boxes in the basement were a haven for spiders and dust.

meanings.sent1: The technology quickly fustiers if not regularly updated.
meanings.sent2: Fashion trends tend to fustier over time, making way for new styles.
meanings.sent3: His once trendy haircut began to fustier as longer styles became popular.
meanings.sent4: The restaurant's menu had to be updated frequently to avoid fustier dishes.
meanings.sent5: As time passed, the once modern building started to fustier in comparison to newer constructions.
